solution: Using the difference-of-squares factorization repeatedly, we have \[\begin{aligned} &(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7) \\ &= \left((\sqrt6+\sqrt7)^2 - (\sqrt5)^2\right)\left((\sqrt5)^2-(\sqrt6-\sqrt7)^2\right) \\ &= \left((13+2\sqrt{42})-5\right)\left(5-(13-2\sqrt{42})\right) \\ &= \left(2\sqrt{42}-8\right)\left(2\sqrt{42}+8\right) \\ &= (2\sqrt{42})^2 - 8^2 \\ &= 168- 64 \\&= \boxed{104}. \end{aligned}\]
model_solution:
## Step 1: Observe the given product and recognize that it matches the pattern of the difference of squares when multiplied in pairs.

\[(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7)\]

## Step 2: Group the first two factors and the last two factors together to apply the difference of squares identity.

\[(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7) = ((\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7))((\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7))\]

## Step 3: Factor out the common terms using the difference of squares identity.

\[((\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7))((\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5
## Step 4:  $((\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7))((\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7)) = ((-4)(-2)((\sqrt 5-\sqrt6-\sqrt7)^2))$

## Step 5:  Simplify the expression by evaluating the remaining square.

$=(-4)(-2)((\sqrt 5-\sqrt6-\sqrt7)^2)=(8)((\sqrt 5-\sqrt6-\sqrt7)^2)$
$=(-4)(-2)((\sqrt 5-\sqrt6-\sqrt7)^2)=(8)((\sqrt 5-\sqrt6-\sqrt7)^2)$
## Step 6:  $=(8)((\sqrt 5)^2-2(\sqrt 5)(\sqrt6)+(\sqrt 6)^2-2(\sqrt 5)(\sqrt7)+2(\sqrt 6)(\sqrt 7)+(\sqrt 7)^2)$
## Step 7:  $(8)((25-2\sqrt{30}+6-2\sqrt{35}+2\sqrt{42}+7))=(8)((38-2\sqrt{30}-2\sqrt{35}+2\sqrt{42}))$

Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{304-16\sqrt{35}-8\sqrt{42}+8\sqrt{210}}.$
